item.title: Russian fireball shows meteor risk may be bigger
item.description: Scientists studying the terrifying meteor that exploded without warning over a Russian city last winter say the threat of space rocks smashing into Earth is bigger than they thought.
item.dc:creator: By Seth Borenstein Associated Press

item.title: Study: 8.8 billion Earth-size, just-right planets
item.description: Space is vast, but it may not be so lonely after all: A study finds the Milky Way is teeming with billions of planets that are about the size of Earth, orbit stars just like our sun, and exist in the Goldilocks zone -- not too hot and not too cold for life.
item.dc:creator: By Seth Borenstein Associated Press

item.title: UCSC robot stars in blockbuster Ender's Game
item.description: SANTA CRUZ -- A bionic robot built by UC Santa Cruz scientists joins Harrison Ford and Asa Butterfield on the big screen for the release of the blockbuster film "Ender's Game.
item.dc:creator: By Nsikan Akpan, Santa Cruz Sentinel

item.title: Robot 'zoo' bring together kids, 'bots
item.description: The robot zoo attraction at the Bay Area Science Festival's closing event gave attendees a close-up look at locally designed cutting-edge robots on Saturday at AT&T Park in San Francisco.
item.dc:creator: By Troy Wolverton twolverton@mercurynews.com

item.title: More than 50 Stanford students fall ill, Norovirus suspected
item.description: The highly contagious Norovirus is believed to be the cause of the gastrointestinal illness that has sickened 52 students in campus dormitories. Four students have been hospitalized and released; all are recovering.
item.dc:creator: By Lisa M. Krieger lkrieger@mercurynews.com

item.title: Fracking and reducing climate change: Can Jerry Brown have it both ways?
item.description: Environmentalists have stepped up their criticisms of California Gov. Jerry Brown, even as he takes nationally prominent positions on global warming, because of his support for oil and gas fracking.
item.dc:creator: By Paul Rogers progers@mercurynews.com

item.title: Parasites found in Southern California 'sea serpent' dissection
item.description: One of two oarfish found in Southern California waters earlier this month had a host of parasites living in its giant, serpent-like body.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press

item.title: Mini space shuttle skids off runway in test flight
item.description: A new, smaller version of NASA's space shuttle is recuperating from a rough first landing.
item.dc:creator: By Marcia Dunn Associated Press

item.title: Climate change pact signed by California, Oregon, Washington and British Columbia
item.description: Saying that the West Coast must lead the way in battling climate change, the governors of California, Oregon and Washington, along with the premier of British Columbia, signed an agreement Monday committing the Canadian province and the three states to coordinate global-warming policies.
item.dc:creator: By Paul Rogers progers@mercurynews.com

item.title: Crop of high-tech farmers sows results with apps
item.description: A University of Vermont project was awarded about $400,000 from the U.S. Department of Agriculture to expand the goCrop app for use around California, where soil conditions are different.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press

item.title: SpaceX to test methane rocket engine in Mississippi
item.description: Private space exploration firm SpaceX will test a methane-fueled rocket engine at NASA's John C. Stennis Space Center in Hancock County.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press

item.title: Bay Area Science Festival kicks off with 50 events
item.description: Light sabers, social robots, open labs -- the Bay Area Science Festival offers events, many of them free, throughout the region for 10 days beginning Thursday.
item.dc:creator: By Sharon Noguchi San Jose Mercury News

item.title: First California condor webcam in the wild goes live in Big Sur
item.description: From pandas to sea otters, video technology is enabling animal lovers to watch wildlife on webcams, with a new California condor cam as the latest example.
item.dc:creator: By Paul Rogers progers@mercurynews.com

item.title: East Bay national labs brace for shutdowns
item.description: Employees at Lawrence Livermore Lab and other Bay Area national laboratories prepared Tuesday for a temporary shutdown that would furlough them indefinitely without pay starting Monday.
item.dc:creator: By Jeremy Thomas jethomas@bayareanewsgroup.com

item.title: 7.2-magnitude Philippines quake kills 12
item.description: MANILA, Philippines -- A 7.2-magnitude earthquake collapsed buildings and roofs and cracked roads Tuesday morning in the central Philippines, killing at least 12 people.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
